metadata.dcterms:title: The contribution of databases to the results of systematic reviews: a cross-sectional study
metadata.dcterms:creator: Hartling, Lisa
Featherstone, Robin
Nuspl, Megan
Shave, Kassi
Dryden, Donna
Vandermeer, Ben
metadata.dcterms:description: We conducted a cross-sectional quantitative analysis to examine the impact of selective database searching on results of meta-analyses. Our sample included systematic reviews with at least one meta-analysis from three Cochrane Review Groups.
metadata.dcterms:subject: Systematic Review
Research Methods
metadata.dcterms:isReferencedBy: Hartling L, Featherstone RM, Nuspl M, Shave K, Dryden D, & Vandermeer B. (2016). The contribution of databases to the results of systematic reviews: a cross-sectional study. BMC Medical Research Methodology. [In review].
metadata.dcterms:rights: Permission from the Alberta Research Centre for Health Evidence (ARCHE) is required to download data files for this project. Attribution is required for use of the data with the statement: The authors acknowledge the Alberta Research Centre (ARCHE) at the University of Alberta for collecting and sharing the data analyzed for this work.
